intro: Lecomtedoxa klaineana, commonly known as the white-flowered lecomtedoxa, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences, and it is known for its aromatic foliage. Lecomtedoxa klaineana is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
